metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13748 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in developer tools in Google Chrome prior to 79.0.3945.79 allowed a local attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from process memory via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13748` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
